result.execSummary:
The defendant Shyla A. Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shyla A. Ward is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shyla A. Ward was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Shyla A. Ward was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
60 days in Marquette County Jail with huber. May transfer to Adams County.
Serve with good time.
Report on or before May 1, 2015 by 7:00 p.m. clean & sober.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence

records.addlTxt: Request approved $100/down and $50/month to quash warrant
to Court from Shyla A Ward
of Warrant cancellation in Custody MASO
BY THE COURT:  Cancel committment and add amount onto payment plan with case number 15CF43 as ordered by the Court.
Set up payment plan of $50.00/month starting November 10th.

ADDRESS INFO for Shyla A. Ward
Current: 250 Maple St, Oxford, WI 53952 United States  (Effective: 03-05-2015)
Prior: 713 S. Miller St., Oxford, WI 53952

Defendant Shyla A. Ward in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that an offer was provided at the pre-trial conference.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant would like to accept one of the offers of the DA.  
BY THE COURT:  Recess to give the defendant time to complete the paperwork.

  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Cts. 1 & 2.  Cts. 3 & 4 to be dismissed.  Atty Hendee states that the agreement was that Restitution would be paid before the plea; however, the State agrees that the defendant will pay the Restitution in full by tomorrow, March 5th by the end of business.  Defendant agrees and asks to serve the time in Adams County.   Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney.  Court accepts defendant's waiver.  Defendant enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 2.  Counts 3 & 4 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.    State has complied with victim notification requirements.


BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Court orders 60 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
  Report on or before May 1, 2015 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
May transfer to Adams County
Good Time
Court Costs = $243.00

Ct. 2:  Court Costs = $243.00
Restitution = $50.00 + $5.00 Surcharge = $55.00 (Defendant has until 4:30pm on March 5th to pay in full to Clerk of Courts Office)
COC office to pay out restitution as it comes in.

Counts 3 & 4 to be dismissed.
Return date on March 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

with conditions:
No violent or abusive contact with Justin Doucette

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.   Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  
BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.  Court accepts defendant's waiver of Attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.

Defendant Shyla A. Ward in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with condition of no violent or abusive contact with Justin Doucette

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
No violent or abusive contact with Justin Doucette  Return date scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
